title: Prince Harry in legal fight to pay for UK police protection
description: The Duke of Sussex wants to be able to pay for a team of officers when he visits with his family.

title: Nino Cerruti: Italian fashion great dies aged 91
description: The celebrated designer and businessman once said: "I have always dressed the same person, myself."

title: Andy Murray loses Sydney final to Aslan Karatsev
description: Andy Murray's bid for his first ATP Tour title since October 2019 ends with defeat by Russian top seed Aslan Karatsev in the Sydney Classic final.

title: Covid in Wales: Rules easing welcomed by sports clubs
description: Up to 500 people are allowed to attend outdoor events from Saturday as Wales' Covid rules ease.

title: England collapse again as Australia take charge of final Ashes Test
description: England's batting again crumples before Australia lost late wickets on the second day of the fifth Ashes Test in Hobart.

title: Tsunami hits Tonga after giant volcano eruption
description: Residents report water crashing through homes as ash rained down from the sky.

title: Lead or step aside, senior Tory Tobias Ellwood tells Boris Johnson
description: Tobias Ellwood says "we need leadership" as MPs are inundated with messages about Downing Street parties.

title: Covid: Coastguard set for busy staycation summer in 200th year
description: Rescue crews had their busiest year in 2021 but expect more emergency shouts in a landmark year.

title: The Ashes: Ollie Pope takes 'flying' catch to remove David Warner for a duck
description: Watch as Ollie Pope dives full length to take a stunning "flying" catch to remove Australia's David Warner for a duck on the second day of the final Test of the Ashes in Hobart.

title: Ex-supermarket boss Lord Sainsbury of Preston Candover dies at 94
description: The company's current chief executive described John Sainsbury as a "shopkeeper to his core".

title: Team GB curler Hugh Nibloe: From dominoes to the Winter Paralympics
description: Curler Hugh Nibloe recounts his journey from an MS diagnosis to being part of Team GB in Beijing.

title: Prince Andrew: Civil case accuser seeks UK witness testimony
description: Lawyers for Virginia Giuffre seek evidence from two people in the UK in the civil sex assault case.

title: 'I'm just happy to have a swing' - Raducanu excited despite Covid disruption
description: Britain's Emma Raducanu says her limited preparation for the Australian Open after testing positive for coronavirus has been "far from ideal".

title: Covid coma pregnancy: Wolverhampton mum 'devastated' to lose son
description: The mum-to-be from Wolverhampton said she was so unwell she did not know her baby was stillborn.

title: Los Angeles railway littered with thousands of parcels stolen from trains
description: The tracks have been cleared multiple times over the last three months as thieves target trains.

title: The Papers: PM in 'last chance saloon' as he 'plots fightback'
description: Fallout from the latest allegations of parties at Downing Street during lockdown dominate the front pages.

title: Novak Djokovic: Tennis star detained ahead of deportation appeal
description: The tennis star will hear on Sunday whether he can stay in the country and compete unvaccinated.

title: The Ashes: 'Would you believe it!?' - Rory Burns run out for a duck by Marnus Labuschagne
description: Watch as opener Rory Burns is run out by Marnus Labuschagne for a duck in the second over of England's first innings in fifth Ashes Test.

title: The Ashes: 'Stop moving the robot!' - Stuart Broad angered by roving camera
description: England's Stuart Broad takes issue with a camera on wheels moving during his attempts to bowl on the second day of the Ashes fifth test.

title: Week in pictures: 8 - 14 January 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: How a colossal block of ice became an obsession
description: Artist Kevin Eason won't ever see his favourite iceberg up close, but he's come to know it so well.

title: MH17: Families' quest for hope years after Ukraine air disaster
description: Since flight MH17 was shot down over Ukraine, victims' families have been on a difficult journey.

title: Remi Wolf is casually rewriting the rules of pop music
description: The former downhill skier and American Idol contestant is making some of pop's most exuberant songs.

title: Omega Mart: Where art meets escape room
description: BBC Click's Chris Fox visits a hi-tech art experience in Las Vegas.

title: Prince Andrew: Ruthless royals move to limit the damage
description: The Royal Family has tried to distance itself from the allegations facing Prince Andrew.

title: The woman who rowed solo across the Atlantic
description: Tori Murden McClure almost died when she tried to row the Atlantic solo, but she went back to sea.

title: Covid: 'We're so proud of how Bertie bounced back'
description: A five-year-old boy with autism is now thriving at school, despite the impact of lockdown.

title: Kazakhstan: Who sparked deadly violence?
description: Authorities are blaming "armed extremists" for the clashes, in which dozens are thought to have been killed.
